etymology.description: 𡕒 is a variant form of 跨(跨). 跨(跨): semantic 足(足) (zú, "foot") + phonetic 夸(夸) (kuā) = a foot placed wide apart -> stride across
etymology.interpretation: The character 𡕒 evolved as a variant to represent the same meaning as 跨(跨), focusing on the concept of a foot positioned for striding or stepping across.

examples.chinese: 考古学家仔细研究𡕒(考古學家仔細研究𡕒)，发现它代表着一个向左的足印(發現它代表着一個向左的足印)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔ xuéjiā zǐxì yánjiū 𡕒, fāxiàn tā dàibiǎo zhe yí gè xiàng zuǒ de zúyìn.
examples.english: Archaeologists carefully studied 𡕒, discovering that it symbolizes a leftward foot imprint.

examples.chinese: 古文经常用𡕒(古文經常用𡕒)，表达向左的意趣(表達向左的意趣)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔwén jīngcháng yòng 𡕒, biǎodá xiàng zuǒ de yìqù.
examples.english: Ancient texts often use 𡕒 to express leftward sentiments.
